item.title: Pokémon Pokopia : on sait enfin pourquoi c’est une exclu Switch 2
item.description: Nous avons posé LA question qui fâche aux développeurs de Pokopia : qu’est-ce qui justifie l’exclusivité Switch 2 ?

item.title: Freebox : attention, votre offre TV changera automatiquement le 17 mars
item.description: Deux chaînes de télévision vont automatiquement changer le 17 mars prochain pour tous les abonnés Freebox.

item.title: Show HN: Simple org-mode web adapter
item.description: I like to use org files a lot, but I wanted some way to browse and edit them on my phone when I'm out. Yesterday I used Codex to make this simple one-file web server that just displays all my org files with backlinks. It doesn't have any authentication because I only run it on my wireguard VPN. I've been having fun with it, hopefully it's useful to someone else! URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=47036891 Points: 2 # : 0

item.title: Show HN: Sentinel Core – Open-source AI video search with real-time dashboard
item.description: We just released a major update to Sentinel Core, our open-source AI-powered video intelligence engine. The new release includes a real-time multi-camera dashboard, semantic video search, and an upgraded detection pipeline. Sentinel Core is built around an AI-native architecture: - YOLOv8 for real-time object detection - CLIP for semantic search (text-to-video queries) - FAISS for vector indexing - FastAPI backend with WebSocket streaming - Fully air-gapped deployment capable You can now: - Stream multiple RTSP/IP camera feeds in a live grid view - Search footage using natural language (e.g.

item.title: Show HN: I built a way for my family to access my accounts in an emergency
item.description: I realized something uncomfortable about my life. We’ve moved most of our lives online, like for banking, investments, subscriptions, crypto, cloud storage, etc. But what if someone needed to step in and manage any of it during a crisis? Not just access but clear instructions. So I built a tool for myself. A secure way to document digital accounts so the people I trust know exactly what to do if they ever need to. It only gives them access when it's actually needed. Until then, everything stays encrypted and invisible. Turns out I'm not the only one with this thought.

item.title: Show HN: PolyClaw – An Autonomous Docker-First MCP Agent for PolyMCP
item.description: I built PolyClaw, an OpenClaw-inspired autonomous agent for the PolyMCP ecosystem. PolyClaw doesn’t just call tools. It plans, executes, adapts — and creates MCP servers when needed. It’s designed for real multi-step, production workflows where agents must orchestrate tools, spin up infrastructure, recover from errors, and deliver complete results end-to-end.

item.title: Show HN: YOPJ – Local AI coding agent with 8-layer security sandbox (no cloud)
item.description: Article URL: https://github.com/WayneCider/YourOwnPersonalJean-Luc URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=47036723 Points: 1 # : 0

Rétroéclairage automatique. Frappe agréable et silencieuse. Bonne autonomie pour un clavier sans fil rétroéclairé. Connexion à trois appareils possible. Poin...

item.title: Show HN: Multi-provider iOS usage alerts for AI subscription caps
item.description: I built AI Usage Tracker, an iOS app that warns you before AI subscription limits cut you off mid-session (e.g. 5-hour windows, weekly caps). I hit this daily while coding: I’d be deep in a session and suddenly hit the cap. Dashboards exist, but they’re not glanceable and there are no practical alerts/widgets. Supports multiple providers in a single screen - Anthropic, OpenAI, MiniMax, Z.ai, Kimi, Codex Features: - 5-hour window + weekly status (simple gauges).

item.title: La série Lucky Luke de Disney+ va-t-elle flop plus vite que son ombre ?
item.description: L'adaptation live-action de la bande dessinée culte arrive enfin sur la plateforme de streaming aux grandes oreilles mais le trailer n'a rien de rassurant.

item.title: Show HN: Idea validation using real problem discussions
item.description: While working on new startup ideas, I realized I was often assuming problems existed without actually seeing how people described them in the wild. So I built a small tool that lets you describe a startup idea and then surfaces real conversations where people discuss that problem. It’s meant to help with early problem discovery before building an MVP. Faster access to real signals. Feedback is highly welcome, as brutal as it can be. URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=47036558 Points: 1 # : 0

item.title: Qista One XS : la meilleure solution pour lutter contre les moustiques ?
item.description: La société française Qista a dévoilé une version allégée de son piège anti-moustiques, désormais pensée pour un usage domestique. Avec ce modèle plus compact et présenté comme plus accessible, l’entreprise cherche à dépasser le cadre des collectivités pour s’adresser directement aux foyers.

item.title: Show HN: Woven-ECS – Multithreaded ECS framework for the web
item.description: I built this to make it easier to create collaborative design tools like infinite canvases. It also works for games. It's an ECS framework that runs in the browser with built-in multithreading via Web Workers, reactive change-tracking queries, and a companion package called “canvas-store” that handles multiplayer sync, local-first persistence, undo/redo, and schema migrations out of the box. GitHub: https://github.com/WillH0lt/woven-ecs URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=47036363 Points: 1 # : 0

item.title: Show HN: Nexus AI – DevOps terminal bridge to Telegram (local-first, BYOK)
item.description: I built this because I was tired of SSH'ing from mobile or carrying laptop to cafes just to check logs. Nexus runs as a daemon on localhost, creates a private Telegram bot that only responds to your OWNER_ID, and executes commands locally. Key tech decisions: - BYOK (Bring Your Own Key): You provide Gemini API key + create your own bot. My operational cost per user = $0 - 3-tier security: Blocked patterns (rm -rf /), dangerous patterns (require confirmation), safe patterns (execute immediately) - Rate limiting: 100 cmd/hour + 2s cooldown + 60s confirmation expiry - Local-first:

item.title: Show HN:AIP Protocol–Solving the agent revocation problem in distributed systems
item.description: I realized something uncomfortable while running agents in production: APIs authenticate the process making a request. But with LLM agents, the process no longer decides the request — the model does. So when an agent is prompt-injected or misaligned, authentication still succeeds. The system verifies who executed the call, not who chose it. Rotating keys or adding revocation checks doesn’t fix this. You’re still trusting the wrapper while the decision lives inside the model. The missing primitive isn’t stronger identity — it’s verifying the action itself. In a typical backend system:

item.title: Show HN: Maths, CS and AI Compendium
item.description: Hey HN, I don’t know who else has the same issue, but: Textbooks often bury good ideas in dense notation, skip the intuition, assume you already know half the material, and get outdated in fast-moving fields like AI. Over the past 7 years of my AI/ML experience, I filled notebooks with intuition-first, real-world context, no hand-waving explanations of maths, computing and AI concepts. In 2024, a few friends used these notes to prep for interviews at DeepMind, OpenAI, Nvidia etc. They all got in and currently perform well in their roles. So I'm sharing. This is an open &

item.title: Show HN: API router that picks the cheapest model that fits each query
item.description: I got frustrated paying $60/M tokens for reasoning queries when a $0.80/M model gives comparable results for most of them. So I built Komilion — a model router that classifies each API request and routes it to a cheaper model that fits. - Drop-in replacement for the OpenAI SDK (change one line:

item.title: Show HN: Regression tests for detecting cross-domain hallucinations in LLMs
item.description: LLMs sometimes generate structurally valid but logically impossible claims when technical and legal domains mix. Example failure mode: A model sees “CVE-2024-XXXX fixed in v2.1” and hallucinates a causal link to “Users must pay retroactive fees under EU regulation Article 56.” To explore this, I built a regression dataset (40 edge cases) covering: Fake identifier bindings (CVE + version) Retroactive fiscal claims Cross-domain causality leaps (Tech → Legal) Over-assertive phrasing without evidence Then I designed a structured system prompt that:

item.title: Actualité : Tesla déploie Grok en Europe : le chatbot controversé d’Elon Musk s'invite dans l’habitacle
item.description: Sept mois après son lancement aux États-Unis, Grok franchit l'Atlantique. Tesla Europe a confirmé le 15 février au soir le déploiement de l'IA d'xAI dans neuf pays : Royaume-Uni, Irlande, Allemagne, Suisse, Autriche, Italie, France, Portugal et Espagne.La mise à jour logicielle 2026.2.6 permet aux conducteurs d'activer le chatbot depuis l'écran tacti...

item.title: La péninsule Ibérique pivote sans que vous le sachiez et ce n’est pas forcément une bonne nouvelle
item.description: Longtemps cru figé, le sous-sol de l'Europe du Sud pivote en réalité dans une direction inattendue. Des mesures récentes confirment que la rotation de la péninsule ibérique s'opère désormais dans le sens horaire, inversant sa trajectoire historique. Ce mouvement imperceptible mais constant redéfinit l'évaluation des risques tectoniques régionaux.

item.title: Le film Dead By Daylight avance enfin dans une vraie direction
item.description: Des scénaristes ont été trouvés pour le film Dead By Daylight, qui n'a toujours pas de réalisateur.

item.description: Alors que les cambriolages sont en forte augmentation depuis la fin de la pandémie, il existe des techniques pour éviter au maximum ce type d'infractions. Parmi elles, l'astuce du verre d'eau permet de détecter un comportement douteux.

item.title: Ca se complique pour les utilisateurs du Fire Stick TV d’Amazon
item.description: Amazon durcit la politique de sécurité de ses anciens Fire TV sous Android et Fire OS en bloquant plus strictement le sideloading et l’installation d’applications IPTV ou de streaming non officielles.

item.title: Google corrige Android 16 avant de lancer Android 17
